metadata.Title: CVE-2021-26676 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
gdhcp in ConnMan before 1.39 could be used by network-adjacent attackers to leak sensitive stack information, allowing further exploitation of bugs in gdhcp.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-26676` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

connman - 1.21-1.2+deb8u1ubuntu0.1~esm1
connman-vpn - 1.21-1.2+deb8u1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: connman package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.21-1.2+deb8u1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
